item.title: How Making Christmas Cookies Can Remind Us Of Our Creator And Reflect Him To The World
item.description: However poor an imitation we are, we are living, breathing reflections of our creative, beautiful, unchanging, patient, hospitable Savior.

item.title: No, Christmas Is Not ‘What You Make It’
item.description: The meaning of Christmas is not in us or anything we do. It is only in Christ and what He did.

item.title: Voter Confidence Is Up Because Election Integrity Was Back In 2024
item.description: Most voters say the November elections were administered well in their communities and nationally, a Pew Research Center survey finds.

item.title: How To Enjoy This Christmas If You’re A Trump Hater (Or If You Sadly Know One)
item.description: Whether you hate Trump or just know someone who does, it's possible to still have a merry Christmas. Here are tips for both.

item.title: Someone Please Tell The Washington Post The Real Meaning Of Christmas Is Not Self-Care
item.description: Christmas is for celebrating the arrival of the Savior of the world, not for ‘celebrating and luxuriating’ in your ‘holiday aloneness.'
